title: Can't install league
body:
"An error occurred while writing installation information to disk. Check to make sure enough disk space is available..."

My roommate bought a new laptop with windows 10, and it has over a TB of free space left (just bought it yesterday) and it won't allow him to install it. When he tries it returns the above message.

The error is throws immediately after clicking "run" on the installer.  What can we do to get this to work? I'm not familiar with windows 10 at all and everything is hard to find.

replies.body:
Since it's a new rig, your roomie's got to make sure his OS is up to date to make sure it has all necessary settings and products to finish up the install.  

Beyond that, I also recommend he goes through each step of the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to make sure that his settings on the new pc is adding League as an exception.  It's very likely that something could be blocking him from installing and downloading game files.

I hope that helps!
